archive.title: The Forge
archive.description: A journey back in time to the beginnings of the artistic path at the State Art Center in Radom, a place that shaped generations of artists.

history.title: History of the State Art Center in Radom
history.paragraph1: The Jacek Malczewski State Art Center in Radom is an institution with a rich history, founded in 1945 by the painter Wacław Dobrowolski. For decades, it was located in the historic Glogier Tenement House, becoming the heart of the city's artistic life. Its goal has always been to provide artistic education for children, youth, and adults, developing their talents and preparing them for further education at art universities.
history.paragraph2: The foundation of the Center was its outstanding educators. Alongside the founder, Prof. Dobrowolski, key roles were played by artists such as Irena Cichowska, who passionately shared their knowledge and skills. It is thanks to them that the Center gained a reputation as a place where true talents were born in an atmosphere of creativity and respect for art.
history.paragraph3: Many distinguished artists passed through the walls of the school that gave rise to the Center. Among others, Andrzej Wajda, later a world-famous film director and Oscar winner, took drawing lessons from Wacław Dobrowolski himself. Zbigniew Rutkowski is one of the many alumni for whom studying at the Center was a decisive step on their artistic path.

photo1.caption: For years, this historic building housed the State Art Center.

photo2.alt: Legendary lecturers of the Art Center
photo2.caption: Legendary lecturers: Irena Cichowska and Prof. Wacław Dobrowolski.

photo3.caption: At the Center, art history was taught by Anna Apanowicz, a significant figure in post-war museum management and the cultural life of Radom and the region.

photo4.caption: Danuta Radzymińska-Nowakowska. From 1969, she was a teacher at the State Art Center in Radom and actively participated in local and national exhibitions.

photo5.caption: Classes in the sculpture studio - a sculpture by Wojciech Głowiak depicting a student of the Center, Zbigniew Rutkowski.

photo6.caption: Photograph from a trip of the State Art Center to Święty Krzyż: including Mirosław Siara, Joanna Szymańska (daughter of Wojciech Stan), Kornel Drzewiecki, Eliza Wojszko, and a sketching Zbigniew Rutkowski.

exhibitions.title: Exhibitions & Plein-Airs
exhibitions.description: An overview of the most important exhibitions, plein-air sessions, and artistic events over nearly 60 years of creative work.

exhibition1968.title: First Solo Exhibition
exhibition1968.description: A debut presentation of youthful works that began the artistic journey.

exhibition1987.title: Plein-Air Painting in Wieliczka
exhibition1987.description: Participation in a plein-air event to raise funds for the preservation of the Salt Mine. The works were auctioned at the Polonia House, and the artist was awarded the title of 'Honorary Miner'.

exhibition1990s.title: Air Force Artistic Creativity Reviews
exhibition1990s.description: Won first place in the painting category, a distinction in graphics, and numerous awards during military service.

exhibitionOngoing.title: Ongoing Exhibition Activity
exhibitionOngoing.description: Regular participation in exhibitions in Radom's galleries (WDK, 'ESTERKA', 'RELAKS') and frequent displays of work at the 'Izdebska-Łazorek' Gallery in Kazimierz Dolny.

exhibition2013.title: My Own Watercolors and Those of My Masters
exhibition2013.description: A solo exhibition presenting both the artist's own works and pieces that inspired him.

exhibition2014.title: Radom in Watercolor - Opening at 'Exlibris' Gallery
exhibition2014.description: An exhibition dedicated to the artist's hometown. Most of the works came from the private collection of Piotr Dróżd, owner of APM and the artist's patron.

exhibition2015.title: Solo Exhibition: 46th Anniversary of Creative Work
exhibition2015.description: Another solo presentation of the artist's work, strengthening his position on the local art scene.

exhibition2018.title: Sacred Architecture of Radom and Beyond
exhibition2018.location: Łaźnia - Radom Club of Creative Communities and Gallery, Żeromskiego 56 St
exhibition2018.description: An exhibition showcasing the difficult art of watercolor, focusing on the sacred architecture of Radom and its surroundings.

artistDialog.name: Zbigniew Jan Rutkowski
artistDialog.description: Watercolor painter with nearly 60 years of experience
artistDialog.alt: Zbigniew Jan Rutkowski painting in plein air
artistDialog.educationText: As a child, a student of Mr. Wacław Dobrowolski's Private School. Graduate of the Jacek Malczewski State Art Center in Radom (1973-75), where he completed courses in painting, drawing, sculpture, and art history, receiving a diploma with distinction 'For outstanding achievements in the field of painting'.

career1.event: First solo exhibition at the 'Łączności' Club in Radom.

career2.event: Participation in a plein-air in Wieliczka; works were auctioned to save the mine. He received the title of 'Honorary Miner of the Salt Mine'.

career3.event: Painted 14 stations of the 'Stations of the Cross' (oil) according to J. Mehoffer for St. Jadwiga's Church in Radom.

career4.event: Board member of the Society of Friends of Fine Arts (Gąska and Esterka Houses), where he ran the 'Amateur Artist Club'.

career5.event: Winner of the 1st place in painting and a distinction in graphics at reviews of creativity in the Air Force (Warsaw, Poznań, Łódź, Tarnów).

career6.event: Numerous solo and group exhibitions, including at WDK, 'Esterka', 'Relaks', 'Izdebska-Łazorek' Gallery in Kazimierz Dolny (Rynek 22), Pedagogical Library (2013), and the Municipal Public Library in Radom (2014).

artistDialog.collectionsText1: The artist's works are in private collections in
artistDialog.collectionsCountries: Poland, Sweden, Argentina, Austria, Switzerland, Canada, and the USA
artistDialog.collectionsText2: A significant part of the collection consists of works owned by the artist's long-time friend and patron, Piotr Drózd (owner of the APM company).
artistDialog.quote: "For over 47 years, watercolor painting has been and is my passion and an escape from everyday life."

announcement.title: From the Author
announcement.body:
The author of the site dedicated to Zbigniew Rutkowski, a distinguished artist and a well-known figure in Radom's culture, is Adam Gierczak. A programming language enthusiast, self-taught, and an aspiring "Jan Matejko", he has been developing his skills in full-stack development for 21 years.

He met Zbigniew Rutkowski in the corridors of the Radom Art Center in 1974-1975, although at the time, being in different groups, they knew each other at most by sight.

The site was created using technologies such as React (Vite), TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS, with significant support from artificial intelligence.
